title: Sales Specialist
description:
The Sales Specialist is also internally referred to as an Acquisition Manager. This person has a “Whatever-It-Takes” attitude and is willing to go above-and-beyond. The manager is willing to hustle and understand that his/her take-home-pay is based on performance. The Acquisition Manager has experience working on the phones, whether this experience is from real-estate sales or another type of phone sales. This is a long-term position with a large potential for growth. You have the opportunity to work with a dynamic team in an environment that challenges you to grow both personally and professionally. This is your chance to earn what you deserve, with no ceiling on your income.
Why is this role important? The sellers who work with us have a variety of difficult circumstances they are going through and they are needing a empathetic person to be able to understand and better articulate their current problem so that we can help craft a solution that helps this homeowner truly reach their desired end state. This is usually accomplished by selling their property to us, but we have other routes as well. So truly understanding the customers needs is crucial. You will need to focus on building trust and vulnerability because many of the people we help are needing assistant getting out of some of the lowest points in their life including, loss of loved ones, messy divorces, foreclosures, needing to move into assisted living or closer to family, and much more.
What does the role entail?Prospecting:• Networking, cold-calling, and related follow-up with the overall objective of generatingacquisition sales (Dials, and time on dials as KPIS)• Prospecting for motivated sellers; The scope of work shall include, but not limited to:Networking, social media activity, foreclosures, MLS Leads, Delinquents, Vacant, Probate list,Pre-Auction List (KPI- 1 self generated appointment per month)
Acquisition Sales:• All Actions Related to Property Acquisitions Sales Process• Attend scheduled appointments to make a cash offer• Refer prospects for listings post appointment. (2 referrals per week)• When needed call prospects to further qualify seller motivation.• Running comparable values;• Meeting with Sellers as deemed needed;• Processing and submission of all required paperwork; (95% of files submitted complete)• Any and all other measures required to acquire properties (which shall be modified based uponacquisition method utilized).
What results is this role responsible for? $90,000 in projected revenue contracted month over monthComplete 75%+ of your pre-set appointmentsSelf-generate 5-7 appointments per weekMaintain a 20% closing rate
Requirements: NO real estate license is needed! 2+ years of sales experience REQUIREDPhone/virtual sales experience preferred but not required
Compensation: This is a hybrid pay structure of a base salary and a tiered commission structureCommissions are uncapped

title: Ab Initio ETL Developer
description: As an Ab Initio developer, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and managing complex ETL solutions that meet company’s technical and business needs.  Role and Responsibilities:Designed and Implemented ETL Processes: Spearhead the design and implementation of robust ETL solutions using Ab Initio software to ensure efficient data and selection, transformation and loading processes this included creating scalable and maintainable data pipelines that supported critical data-driven decisions.Performance Optimization: Regularly perform tuning and optimization of ETL processes to improve performance, reducing data processing time significantly and enhancing system reliability.Data Quality Assurance: Implement data quality checks within the ETL workflows to ensure the accuracy and integrity of data, which reduce data discrepancies and improve trust in data-driven insights.Collaboration and Requirements Gathering: Work closely with Business analysts and other stakeholders to translate business needs into technical specifications ensuring that all data solutions were aligned with business objectives and user needs.Technical Leadership and Training: Provided technical guidance and training to junior developers fostering a collaborative team environment and enhancing overall team productivity and knowledge on Ab-Initio tools and best practices.Innovative Data Solutions: Introduced new techniques and components within Ab Initio suite such as the use of Meta-Environment (EME) for better meta data management which streamlines data operations and supported compliance with data governance standards.Continuous improvement: Actively contributed to continuous improvement initiatives by proposing and implementing system enhancements that improve data processing workflows and reduced costs. Required Qualification and Skills: Experience in the Analysis, Design and Development of Data warehousing solutions and in developing strategies for Extraction, Transformation and Loading (ETL) mechanism using Ab InitioSolid experience as an RDBMS developer, with stored procedures, query performance tuning and ETLHands-on experience creating graphs to meet complex business requirementsStrong US healthcare experienceExperience in handling Generic graphs, Plans, PSETs and complex ab initio graphsExtensive understanding on MFS, PDL is requiredShould have good understanding of SQL and ability to write simple/complex SQL's as per requirement.Experience with SQL performance tuningFamiliar with basic unix commands (awk, sed, grep, find,etc) and 1-2 years experience writing unix scriptsExperience with Express>IT, Conduct>IT, continuous flows will be preferredExperience integrating with Hadoop environment

description:

We're a company that genuinely cares about our people, our products, our consumers and the environment.

Our unique, informal culture champions courage, determination and collaboration. Knowing we have an open and supportive team means each of us has the freedom to take responsibility and ownership. We have a shared passion to work hard, innovate and push boundaries.

United by the belief that when we strive for growth, anything is possible. While we might not be the largest company in our industry, we believe we can have the biggest impact because: Together We Have the Power to Win. Quality Control Floor Staff Manufacturing

Weekend Midnights (FridaySunday and every other Thursday 5:00pm5:00am)

The hourly wage for this position is $19.82 to $20.62 plus $2/hour shift dif. New Hire Sign On Bonus - $2,000 What we're about: Innovation-We consistently generate new ideas, thinking outside the box while remaining strategically focused. We always think in terms of possibilities, not limitations. Collaboration-We rely on open and honest communication to develop productive working relationships within and across our business units and functions. The mutual respect we have for our colleagues enables us to challenge each other, leading to an even more cohesive team. Focus-We maintain a laser-like focus on our consumers. We will grow by leveraging consumer insights on all of our brands and will continue to be industry leaders. Entrepreneurialism-We pride ourselves on fostering this spirit where risk-taking and action is encouraged. We are extremely competitive externally, but not internally. This highly visible position is located at our Vancouver, WA Facility. What you'll do: This position will be responsible for specialized and routine production inspection activities according to established Standard Operating Procedures and Good Manufacturing Practices requirements. Essential Functions: Follow Standard Operating Procedures (SOP), company policies, safety policies and practices, quality standards, and Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP). Responsible at all times for ensuring that tasks are performed according to food safety, quality, and regulatory guidelines. Provide assistance for all questions regarding quality defects. Audit all areas for quality and GMP conformance. Ensure batch documentation is filled out according to requirements. Update and complete documentation and logs as required, including observation reports. Photocopy, sort, and/or file documents or reports as requested. Inform Quality Control (QC) Shift Lead, QC Supervisor or QC Manager on all personnel issues. Identify and implement improvements to the QC procedures as needed. Perform the following according to exact established procedures: Equipment checks Weight checks Facility sanitation Pack out quality Lot and Code dates Demonstrate a working knowledge of production equipment (processing and pack out equipment) and its related impact on overall quality. Identify urgent quality situations, assess the nature of the problem then contain, resolve or recommend action quickly. Ensure all personnel in the clean rooms and production areas are wearing the proper attire. Ensure proper cleaning is performed prior to the next production run. Ensure the line clearance inspection is performed and documented before each production run and inspect the production area to ensure that all components from previous run are removed before another production run is started. Check the Equipment Use Log to ensure it is correctly and completely filled out before each production run. Verify that the components match the Work Order, Bill of Materials (BOM) and actual kit. Stop the lines immediately if a discrepancy is found, contact the QC Shift Lead, QC Supervisor, or QC Manager and help to perform an investigation. Pull quality samples, in a sanitary manner, at all applicable production steps which include but is not limited to hot vitamin slurry as well as bulk product. Calibrate or verify all quality equipment. Monitor the dry rooms using a basic understanding of the Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) system. Perform other duties as required. What you'll need: High school diploma, GED, and/or any equivalent combination of experience and education that could likely provide the required knowledge, skills, and abilities needed to perform the job.

Previous QC experience in an FDA regulated industry preferred. Ability to read, understand, and carry out oral and written instructions.

Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with others. Ability to sort, check, count, and verify numbers.

Ability to prepare routine administrative documentation.

Ability to receive, track, and distribute materials, supplies, and equipment.

Ability to detect quality problems and report information to appropriate personnel.

Ability to maintain quality, safety, and/or infection control standards.

Good problem-solving skills.

Good interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.

Ability to define problems, collect data, and establish facts rather than opinions.

Ability to comply with standards and procedures.

Good understanding of 21 CFR 111 GMP for Dietary Supplements and NSF -ANSI 173.

Ability to maintain punctuality and predictable attendance. Ability to wear appropriate personal protective equipment and clean room attire; perform moderate physical activity which requires standing and/or walking for more than four (4) hours per day and up to twelve (12) hours per shift and lifting and carrying items weighing up to 50 pounds; and perform work onsite in a light industrial environment, including some exposure to non-toxic dust.What we'll offer: Competitive salary including annual bonus & Stock Incentive Program Comprehensive benefits package along with generous 401K Career ownership & development Diversity & Sustainability As a Church & Dwight U.S. employee, you (and your family) will have access to medical, dental, vision, basic life insurance, and Paid Parental Leave among other benefits and perks. U.S. employees are entitled to 8 Company paid holidays, 6 floating holidays, and up to 14 paid vacation days starting in their first year of employment depending on hire date.

You are also able to participate in our 401k retirement plan (with company match). Learn more about benefits at Church & Dwight.

Church & Dwight Co. Inc., a $5 billion company, was founded in 1846 and is headquartered in Ewing, New Jersey. We are one of the fastest growing Consumer Packaged Goods companies and as a testament to our performance; the company was added to the S&P 500 in 2016. Church & Dwight is a leader in the Household Consumer Products and Personal Care industry, with such brands as ARM & HAMMER, Trojan, First Response, Nair, Spinbrush, Oxi Clean, Vitafusion, Orajel, Batiste and more. title: Senior Director, Digital Activation
description:
Overview

The Company:

Hearts & Science has been inspired by confident marketers seeking business advantage in a world of personalized digital marketing, where CRM and addressable channels converge, and decisions must be made in real time to aggregate effective reach and deliver the right message at the right time.

Designed to inform brand strategies with real-time insights, Hearts & Science is a data-driven marketing agency with expert media planning and buying capabilities, among other services that include shopper marketing, marketing innovation and content activation.

Senior Director, Digital

As a Senior Director, you will play a critical role leading the day-to-day set up and optimization of performance campaigns across multiple programmatic buying platforms - and lead the team as the main point of contact for the strategy to improve campaign performance. You will define, execute and optimize digital programmatic media channel strategies and initiatives ensuring that pacing, performance and the Digital Activation Process is activated correctly across the area of responsibility is the primary focus of this job.

Note: This position is located in the Burbank/Los Angeles area.

Qualifications

10+ years digital experience, including a minimum of 5 years’ experience managing, mentoring, and nurturing a diverse team in a fast-paced organization Experience within the entertainment category preferred Technical and strategic understanding of programmatic, search and social buying and activation required. Experience working with Ad Technology stacks and implementation processes Strong knowledge of marketing technologies & tools (Web analytics, tag management, ad servers, attribution) Strong analytical skills and understanding of entertainment industry KPI's Exceptional analytics skills, and confidence acting on marketing data and insights Comprehensive biddable platform, (search, social and programmatic), campaign setup knowledge across (but not limited to), Google (Google Ads, DV360, Amazon, Meta, TikTok, Snap)Working knowledge of 3rd party verification tools, including IAS


Responsibilities

Extensive understanding of all major digital biddable platforms, product offerings and their respective capabilitiesDeep understanding and proven excellence within hands-on-keyboard (activation) nuances and best practices across all biddable platforms and ad-serving operations Ensures highest levels of performance and thought leadership within specialist divisions (search, social, programmatic, ad-ops and tagging), including creating and circulating POVsDevelops and maintains strong relationships with key digital partners and keeps teams abreast of first to market opportunities, tech, data, and regulation updatesKey stakeholder in leading upfront deals and negotiations (JBPs) Creating and driving best-in-class biddable digital media strategies that deliver against client objectives within search, social and programmatic channels for assigned client Providing inputs and guidance around campaign design, including requirements for success and optimal use of biddable platforms Working side by side with Integrated Planning team to ensure tight coordination of campaign setup, adjustments and optimization performance is efficient and effective Working with Strategy team to understand goals, address client needs, and communicate results and insights back to clients Implementing Business Intelligences tools and new capabilities (e.g., new supply & data sources, new media measurement techniques, etc.) Accountability over client’s budgets Developing strong relationships with clients, key digital platform partners and global counterpart colleagues Setting Budgets, KPI's and measurement frameworkCollaborating with MarSci Team for development and implementation of Test and Learn agenda and framework.Delivering credible thought leadership on Digital Activation’s role in the Marketing ecosystem, providing a multi-year vision of the program and lead proactive insights on channel opportunities through both short-term and long-term business lensesLeading communication of Digital Activation's tech/data needs with cross-functional partners (Product Management, Analytics, IT, etc.) to ensure seamless deployment of digital campaigns and effectively report results to all stakeholdersAbility to effectively manage costs while exceeding performance goals and maintaining quality standards.Excellent communication skills, ability to distill key ideas for non-digitally centric teamsManaging and mentoring a large team of Digital Activation specialists, providing day-to-day guidance as well as career growth and development, across multiple markets.Directing and managing external agency and vendor teams of 25+ Ensuring team manages and efficiently optimizes programs within budget and KPI goalsTracking innovation within the industry, and evaluate and identify new partners and technology that will drive best-in-class channel strategies for Hearts and our clients


Compensation Range: $150,000 - $200,000 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on relevant experience, other job-related qualifications/skills, and geographic location (to account for comparative cost of living). title: Laboratory Technician
description:
Kelly is hiring a Laboratory Technician for one of our food manufacturing clients in Calhoun, GA
Quality Department3rd shift 10pm - 630am shift Mon. – Fri. 8hrs (Possible Sat)Temp to hire Pay: $20.50/hr

Primary Purpose- Laboratory Technicians work with our Production, Sanitation, Maintenance and Warehouse teams in order to provide testing of samples, data integrity, and the overall integrity of our quality and safety for all Kerry ingredients for our customers.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities1. Perform timely physical & analytical sampling and testing on finished goods using a variety of standard test methodology.2. Responsible for HACCP program verifications and documentation.3. Perform laboratory equipment calibrations, record, and communicate results.4. Perform chemical titrations on in-house sanitation chemistry.5. Perform aseptic microbiological sampling of products and environment.6. Communicate any finished good, raw material, HACCP, GMP, or quality non-conformances or deviations in a timely fashion with production and quality management, put any non-conform product on Hold.7. Comply with, follow, and help implement all plant GMPs, policies, SSOPs and SOPs.8. Communication and inter-department / intra-department teamwork.9. Discriminating sensory evaluation, critical thinking, and problem resolution.10. Report all Accidents and Near-Misses immediately.11. Work with our systems to enter all of our data and run reports.12. Line pre-operation inspection, cleaning verification, documentation, release and communication of the results.13. Train employees on quality subjects and procedures.14. Perform laboratory housekeeping and upkeep.15. Work assigned schedule and cover absences, come to work on time fully prepared.16. Other duties and projects as assigned.
The above listed duties are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities or duties required. Incumbents will be expected to perform other duties as assigned.
Minimum RequirementsExperience:1. Basic computer skills, with the ability to work in Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Outlook, and Microsoft Word. Kerry will train on our specific systems including SAP.2. Strong organizational skills & excellent communication skills are essential.3. Ability to read, write and communicate in English at a level to facilitate the understanding of the terminlolgy of the job.4. Ability to comprehend and follow written and/or verbal procedures or instructions.5. Ability to organize and plan ahead to maximize job efficiency and work safely.6. Ability to drive for excellence in all areas; focus on effective internal and external customer-supplier relationships.7. Ability to work in a team, with other departments, and with management.8. Ability to work all scheduled shifts and report to work station on time, fully prepared. Ability to work overtime to cover absences.
Education:• High School Diploma or GED
Preferred Skills & Qualifications1. Previous work experience within a laboratory environment.2. Flavor/ Fragrance or food lab experience also preferred.
Working Conditions• Food manufacturing plant• Warehouse environment• Laboratory environment• GMP / Uniform / Safety toe shoes / Hairnet

Physical Requirements• Ability kneel, bend, squat, stoop, carry, reach, stand, grip, push, pull, arm extensions and perform elevated work.• Ability to stand and walk for up to 12 hours at a time while wearing proper PPE (safety toe, slip resistant, full foot coverage shoes; hairnets / beardnets; issued uniforms; hearing protection; and eye protection as required by plant).• Ability to lift up to 50 pounds with assistance, not on daily or weekly bases. Daily lifting of samples is 10 pounds or less.• Ability to work in hot, cold or wet environments.

title: Audio Video Project Manager
description:
At Diversified, we don't just follow tech trends - we set them by leveraging the best in technology and ongoing advisory services to transform businesses. Our comprehensive suite of solutions is engineered to help our clients build connections that make a difference – whether by inspiring viewers, engaging associates, motivating audiences, or streamlining and safeguarding operations.

Our dedicated teams craft solutions experienced by millions every day including:

 Delivering the fan experience at one of 100+ sports facilities for the NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL, MLS, NCAA  Building the first fly pack broadcast system transportable by air - bringing the 2022 World Cup and Super Bowl into homes across the world  Engineering the first high-density pixel canvas to display HD content at that scale for the Vornado, Marriott Marquis LED Display in Times Square, NY  Empowering and monitoring communication and collaboration solutions within multi-national companies around the globe 

Founded in 1993, we’re a global organization serving local needs with associates worldwide. Learn more at onediversified.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter .

 What part will you play? 

A project manager (PM) is responsible for the scope, schedule, cost, quality and client satisfaction of a project throughout its entire lifecycle, from Initiating through Closing phases. However, the PM depends on the help of other people to perform most of the actual activities of the project. A project managers role is primarily focused around written and verbal communication to all project stakeholders.

The PM is responsible for overseeing, and performing project management functions on all AVE projects, budgets and scopes. The PM will act as the responsible person on their assigned projects and have direct control over all project activities.

 What will you be doing? 

Primary Duties And Responsibilities

Daily activities include project communications, scheduling, task lists for technicians, managing deliverables from engineering, CAD and Programming and overseeing the completion of projects. The PM is responsible for completing systems integration projects on time, on budget and achieving high customer satisfaction from our customers. The majority of this employee's time will be spent managing projects and communicating with all project stakeholders. This person will be helping to constantly improve the established Diversified processes.

As the primary interface to the client, the project manager develops a strong long-term relationship. He manages the client relationship, including expectations, communications and satisfaction.

 Coordinates and communicates.  Provides clear leadership and ownership for the project within Diversified, including accurate and timely verbal and written communication and follow up.  Coordinates all activities associated with the timely, accurate and on-budget completion of the project, including engaging stakeholders, delegating responsibilities clearly and running client and internal project meetings.  Provides support and assistance to team members as needed in order help them be successful and get the job done.  Ensures appropriate and frequent communication between stakeholders.  Resolves destructive conflict.  Designs, plans, and coordinates work teams with regard to AVE installation projects  Assumes ownership of individual projects and assignments  Establishes and maintains communication with Account Executives, Directors, installation technicians, subcontractors, clients, etc.  Develops and communicates project updates as required.  Provides constant monitoring of labor, equipment and materials budgets.  Provides and/or directs technical and administrative support to project team members.  Develops and maintains all related project schedules.  Performs field verification of prospective work site. Documents all issues with site and keeps everyone informed of potential issues and solutions.  Coordinates all drawings and documentation between all internal and external stakeholders.  Facilitates and directs design reviews to assure proper documentation in the field.  Coordinates all system programming and final checkout of systems. Provides punch-list of remaining tasks after substantial completion.  Contracts with contractors and other trades when necessary.  Monitors status of projects including cost, timing and staffing to ensure timely and accurate completion of projects.  Ensures quality and continuous improvement.  Coordinates training & turnover of projects to client, service department, & sales. 

Complexity

 Every project is different and every set of project stakeholders is different. The PM needs to negotiate a very complex set of variables between system design, site conditions and a widely varying set of expectations with multiple stakeholders. The skill of communicating both verbally and in writing to manage all these variables takes a very high level of awareness, emotional intelligence and people management skills. The PM is constantly managing the forces of change in every project environment. Balancing schedules, budgets, scope, quality and client satisfaction are a very complex set of variables. 

Decision Making Authority

 Takes full ownership of project  Acts as the single point of responsibility and accountability for the project.  Ensures schedule performance, quality of solution delivered to client, and client satisfaction.  Manages and reports on the project’s financials, including ensuring budget performance and profitability. Ensures timely and correct billings to client.  Demonstrates proactivity, responsiveness, and follow through.  Communicates decision options to stakeholders and manages those decisions.  Manages a complex array of decisions at every point of the project but is rarely the sole decision maker. 

Physical Working Environment

 Physical Demands: 

 The physical demands described here are representative of those that may be met by an employee. The employee may be exposed to construction site conditions on a regular basis. Employee will be responsible for their safety while on job sites and to comply with all safety regulations in place by the GC. Use of PPE is usually required on job sites. The employee can typically spend at least 40% of their time on their feet and be required to mobile around the construction site. The employee must have the ability to occasionally climb ladders, use stairs and lift and/or move materials up to 20 pounds in construction areas. The individual is regularly required to use keyboards, test equipment and controls required for SI installation projects. Specific vision abilities required for this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision and depth vision. When not on construction sites, the employee will experience normal office conditions and be required to use office equipment such as computers, peripherals, etc. 

Travel

 Frequent travel by car and occasional airplane trips are required. Employee must possess a valid driver’s license in their state of residence. Employee will be required to use their own vehicle and will be reimbursed for mileage at the current corporate rate. Local travel to job sites (within a 2 hour driving distance each way) will make up 70-90% usually but remote travel can be up to 30% of the job at times. 10% remote travel is required on a regular basis. 

What do we require from you?

Education/Certifications

 Associates/Bachelors degree required and/or equivalent experience.  A PMP certification from the Project Management Institute is desired. AVIXA CTS certification  Other relevant certifications may be required or preferred based on the technology focus of the position. 

Required/Desired Knowledge, Experience And Skills

A minimum of 2 years of experience as a project manager required.

 3 - 5+ years of experience with oversight of long-term projects preferred.  Ability to travel to project sites as needed, sometimes daily, in western NY and Upstate NY  Familiarity with audio/video systems installations.  Knowledgeable of low voltage electrical projects.  Strong verbal and written communication skills.  Supervisory and people skills.  The Project Manager shall have the ability and skills to diagnose and resolve complex technical, political and people related problems. 

A project manager typically has these base skills.

 Has a high level of both written and verbal communication skills.  Focused on clients and able to understand how they can use technology from Diversified to meet their business needs.  Approachable; works well on teams. Is a natural leader.  Delegates effectively.  Good at setting and managing people’s expectations.  Personally organized, manages time well, and sets clear priorities. Sets an example for preparation, punctuality, and professional appearance.  Excellent at planning.  Forecasts and manages risks.  Problem solver who can remain effective in tense situations. 

To learn more about becoming part of the Diversified team, visit us at http://diversifiedus.com/about/careers/ or email us at careers@onediversified.com .

Diversified is an equal employment opportunity employer and all aspects of employment will be based on job requirements, individual qualifications, merit, performance and business needs. We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, age, disability or genetic information, or any other applicable characteristic protected under federal, state or local law. We celebrate diversity and encourage people of all backgrounds to apply for available positions. Individuals needing assistance or an accommodation to complete an application due to a disability, may contact Human Resources at   careers@onediversified.com  .

Our compensation ranges reflect the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The pay details below range from our lowest geographic market up to our highest geographic market. Pay is based on several factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills and experience depending on the position offered, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits.

We’re redefining and disrupting the industry while changing people’s financial lives with better experiences and better technology. We believe in building inclusive and diverse workplaces, where every voice is heard. Come help us build for the future!

Summary

Build the platforms that support the delivery of experiences that empower advisors and help clients achieve their dreams. Work with a hardworking team of data engineers, designers, data scientists and financial experts to discover, build and launch features that enable clients to achieve financial security.

This role will support the implementation the enterprise operational data strategy and supporting data platform at NM. You will get the opportunity to operate strategically between data teams, architects, and platform engineers to deliver our target state data integration patterns, data transformation capabilities, privacy/security controls, and consumption in a modern data landscape.

Primary Duties & Responsibilities

Set Product Vision

: Responsible for product vision and appropriate positioning with key team members across the organization.

Develop Roadmap

: Foster the development, acceptance and communication of roadmap.

Define and track critical metrics for measure of success.

Gather Requirements

: Participate in cross functional work to solicit key requirements relative to the accountable product.

Define the product

: Responsible for multiple medium complexity products and product features from start to finish.

Stakeholdering

: Maintain the awareness and ability to articulate the product story to a broader audience outside the internal team with additional experience and maturity in the domain.

Data & Customer Research

: Advise product decisions with both qualitative and quantitative data on behavior and experimentation.

Feature Prioritization

: Develop and maintain multiple prioritized backlog of user stories for implementation according to business value or return on investment.

Qualifications

Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience in computer science, Engineering, or a related technical subject area.

4-5 Years of prior experience with at least 4 working in a Product Management Role, with agile team experience.

At least 3 years of working on a data or analytics team.

A deep understanding of cloud-based data platform architectures.

Experience interacting with external suppliers.

Knowledge of cloud native architecture, cloud tooling and DevOps

Technical expertise spanning data engineering, data platforms and analytics.

Must have demonstrated cross functional work in previous experience along with strong communication skills, time management, project management skills, eye for business and high self-awareness/EQ.

Demonstrated previous research experience, influence skills, initial leadership exposure, ability to translate product requirements into technical requirements, and work in ambiguity and solutioning.

Solves complex problems; take a new perspective on existing solutions; exercise judgment based on the analysis of multiple sources of information.

Knowledge Preferred: formal business analyst, engineering or testing experience, knowledge of the financial services industry, certification or experience with Product Owner or Scrum Master role, Certifications in Google, Azure Cloud, or AWS

title: Finance & Administration Lead
description:
The Finance & Administration Lead plays a critical role in managing the financial and administrative aspects of the Law and Compliance Department. The position combines financial acumen and familiarity with the department's operations and working with counterparts in the company's financial planning, reporting, and accounts payable areas. This position also oversees a team of administrative assistants and will be responsible for core operational functions to the department, including knowledge management, onboarding new associates, and coordinating department technology and systems.

Financial management:

Develop projections for the annual budgeting cycles and forecasting processes Monitor expenses and provide regular reports to department leadership. Collaborate with enterprise finance and accounting teams to ensure accurate budgeting, allocations, and payment of expenses. Process Improvement: Drive efficiency, streamlining processes, workflows, and procedures where possible. Analyze and improve business processes within the department while ensuring quality of service. Oversee and implement technology solutions to enhance efficiency (e.g., project management, e-billing, legal hold). Vendor relationships: Serve as primary billing and administrative contact for outside counsel and legal service vendors, Aid with engagement letters, conflicts review and waivers, rate negotiation, and optimization of quality for legal support.

Supervision: Provide work direction and leadership to a team of administrative assistants.

Training and mentorship, set performance goals and conduct performance evaluations. Coordinate administrative workloads, schedule, and coverage for the department. Background and Experience required:

Bachelor's degree with an applicable major (e.g., finance, business). Finance, operations, or consulting experience, preferably in a related field (e.g., legal, compliance). Commitment to strong standards of service and relationship building. Strong collaboration skills with an exceptional capacity for critical thinking and problem solving. Proactive communication skills and demonstrated ability to work with different audiences (e.g., management, legal staff, and business partners). Versatility, maturity, and ability to work both independently and as part of a team, to organize, plan, prioritize, and complete projects with competing deadlines. Preferred additional qualifications: Experience working with legal operations systems, including e-billing software (e.g., Legal Tracker), enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems (e.g., SAP), and legal hold software. Experience working with an in-house law department for a large company. Leadership experience. Financial services or insurance industry related experience. Experienced with process improvement, flexible working style, and adaptability to new technologies (strong inclination for continuous learning and self-improvement).Securian Financial believes in hybrid work as an integral part of our culture. Associates get the benefit of working both virtually and in our offices. This role requires you to live within a commutable distance (90 minutes) of our Home Office in downtown St. Paul. You'll join us 2-3 days each week in our offices to collaborate and build relationships. Our policy allows flexibility for the reality of business and personal schedules. When working in our offices at least two days per week isn't feasible (vacations, illness, travel, etc.), an eight day per month standard is an option.

title: Associate Director, Digital
description:
Overview

The Company:

Hearts & Science has been inspired by confident marketers seeking business advantage in a world of personalized digital marketing, where CRM and addressable channels converge, and decisions must be made in real time to aggregate effective reach and deliver the right message at the right time.

Designed to inform brand strategies with real-time insights, Hearts & Science is a data-driven marketing agency with expert media planning and buying capabilities, among other services that include shopper marketing, marketing innovation and content activation.

Associate Director, Digital

The Associate Director plays a key role as a day-to-day lead for development of plans, executing digital buys, ensuring pacing and performance are optimized, client interaction, working with internal teams and leading the team responsible for digital activation. Ensuring that the Digital Activation Process is used correctly across the area of responsibility is a critical focus of this job.

A positive attitude and willingness to “roll up your sleeves” is also critical to get the job done. Experience working with across several media channels is preferred and a curiosity in emerging media platforms is a must.

Qualifications

5+ years of experience in media planning and expert knowledge of digital buying, hands-on experience using demand-side platforms (The Trade Desk, DV360 or similar) a plusExperience managing media teams and client relationshipsExperience working with large data sets and understanding of methodologies for evaluating dataAbility to self-manage, juggle multiple priorities, and pay strong attention to detailsExcellent communication skills, ability to distill key ideas for non-digitally centric teamsProven ability to work with and influence cross-functional teamsStrong knowledge of MS Excel and ability to coach others in shortcutsWorking knowledge of 3rd party verification tools, including IASHands-on experience with campaign workflow tools, including Prisma

title: Director of ERP - JD Edwards Enterprise One
description:
M/I Homes has been building new homes of outstanding quality and superior design for more than 40 years. Founded in 1976 by Irving and Melvin Schottenstein and guided by Irving's drive to always "treat the customer right," we have fulfilled the dreams of over 140,000 homeowners and grown to become one of the nation's leading homebuilders. M/I Homes started as a family business and grew into a national leader in a single generation with divisions in 17 markets, including Austin, Charlotte, Chicago, Cincinnati, Columbus, Dallas, Detroit, Ft. Myers/Naples Houston, Indianapolis, Minneapolis, Nashville, Orlando, Raleigh, San Antonio, Sarasota, and Tampa.Job Summary: Directs and coordinates the development, production activities and optimization of the JD Edwards Enterprise One ERP system by defining the goals and objectives for required computer information systems, in addition to planning for, developing, and implementing new computer applications for existing systems operations. An efficient ERP system will help maximize the profitability of the company by managing budgets and cost controls for communities, lots, and options.Duties and Responsibilities: Manages the team of people responsible for the daily operation of JD Edwards Homebuilder Management and Accounting functions including technical design, CNC work, administration, upgrades, archiving and business operations. Responsible for ensuring the seamless integration of JD Edwards into our business processes, collaborating with various departments to enhance system functionality and efficiency, and working with internal and external IT team members to integrate data to various systems. Provide technical support and troubleshooting assistance to end-users and resolve system-related issues promptly. Documenting and creating processes for common tasks and troubleshooting. Analyze root cause of issues and work with teams to provide solutions. Consults with appropriate management representatives to determine information systems requirements, boundaries, and priorities of new projects, and to plan for system capacity and equipment acquisitions. Confers with appropriate departments and management staff regarding proposed projects to further define nature of projects; ensures implementation of and smooth transition to new systems. Prepares requests for proposals and solicits consultations and sales for systems analysis, programming, and computer services from outside firms; contracts, establishes and maintains working relationship with information management specialists, technical personnel, and appropriate vendors. Consults with internal Infrastructure team to perform hardware analysis to define equipment needs and requirements. Analyzes department workflow and job tasks of staff to recommend reorganization or department realignment to coincidence with projects, company planning and business objectives. Develops and implements information systems policies and procedures to ensure delivery of quality technical and end-user support to increase efficiency and minimize down time of system; assists staff in diagnosing and resolving computer equipment problems. Identifies emerging technologies that may be beneficial in meeting company goals and objectives. Performs additional duties as required. Supervisory Responsibilities: Directly supervises ERP staff through leadership and guidance of operating activities. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with Company policies and procedures.

Requirements

Minimum Education Experience: Bachelor's degree (B.A. or B.S.) or equivalent in specialized training from a four year college or technical school combined with a minimum of 10 years related experience; related supervisory experience; and thorough knowledge of home building industry relative to required information systems. Skills and Abilities: Persuasive attitude with outstanding leadership, negotiation, organizational and detail-oriented aptitude. Strong identification and problem-solving skills; ability to research, interpret, analyze, and evaluate given information relative to systems development and implementation, and technical and end-user support. Excellent verbal and written communication skills for interaction with people inside and outside the organization. Ability to handle responsibilities for establishing and maintaining large budgets, inventories, and purchases. Proven record of accomplishment of successfully leading ERP implementations and managing projects. Thorough knowledge of current information systems trends; and working knowledge of given markets in relation to information systems environments. Work Conditions and Physical Requirements: Onsite in Columbus, Ohio at our Corporate Office.

Benefits

M/I Homes offers a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, paid time off and paid holidays, paid parental leave, traditional and Roth 401(k) options, profit sharing plan, employee stock purchase plan, employee home purchase plan and more.We are committed to attracting, developing, and retaining diverse talent that reflects the customers we serve and the communities where we live and work.We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.#IND123

title: Consumer Experience and Specialty Retail Sales Director
description:
Job Title: Consumer Experience and Specialty Retail Sales Director
Company Overview:Fit Butters is a leading provider of premium nut butter products, committed to promoting health, wellness, and fitness. Our delicious spreads are crafted with natural ingredients to fuel active lifestyles and support individuals in achieving their health goals. We are dedicated to innovation, sustainability, and empowering our community to live healthier, happier lives.
Position Overview:Fit Butters is seeking a passionate and strategic leader to serve as the Consumer Experience and Specialty Retail Sales Director. This individual will be responsible for enhancing the consumer experience across all touchpoints including, but not limited to, events, email, SMS and driving sales within specialty retail channels. As a key member of the sales and marketing team, the Consumer Experience and Specialty Retail Sales Director will play a critical role in driving brand awareness, building customer loyalty, and maximizing revenue growth.
Responsibilities:Consumer Experience Enhancement: Develop and implement strategies to enhance the overall consumer experience, including website usability and connections, customer service standards, and product accessibility. Identify opportunities to optimize consumer engagement, satisfaction, and loyalty through innovative initiatives, programs, and software.Specialty Retail Sales Strategy: Develop and execute a comprehensive sales strategy to drive revenue growth within specialty retail channels, including natural food stores, health food stores, fitness centers, and specialty retailers. Establish sales targets, performance metrics, and KPIs to measure success and track progress.Retail Account Management: Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with key retail accounts, including buyers, category managers, and store managers. Identify opportunities to expand distribution, negotiate contracts, secure prominent placement, and visibility for Fit Butters products on shelves and online platforms. Support retailers with merchandising strategies, promotional campaigns and in-store activations.Event Planning Strategy: Develop and execute a comprehensive events strategy aligned with Fit Butters' brand objectives and marketing goal including event planning and execution, brand activations, partnerships and sponsorships, event marketing and promotion, attendee experience and post-event analysis and reporting. Events include, but not limited to, national B2B events, national consumer-facing events, regional activations and in-store demos.Email and SMS Strategy: Develop and execute a comprehensive email and SMS strategy to drive revenue growth and consumer retention through campaign planning and execution, segmentation and targeting, content creation, automated workflows, A/B testing and optimization, performance analysis and reporting and compliance and best practices via Klaviyo software.Market Analysis and Insights: Conduct market research, consumer surveys, and competitive analysis to identify market trends, consumer preferences, and opportunities for growth within specialty retail channels. Use data-driven insights to inform sales and marketing strategies and tactics.Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, product development, operations, and finance, to ensure alignment and integration of efforts to support specialty retail sales and event objectives. Serve as a liaison between internal teams and external retail partners to facilitate communication and drive collaboration.Training and Development: Provide training, support, and guidance to external retail partners to ensure alignment with Fit Butters' brand values, product positioning, and sales objectives. Conduct product training sessions, sales presentations, and educational seminars as needed.
Qualifications:· Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or related field required; MBA or advanced degree preferred.· Proven track record of success in sales and account management roles within the consumer packaged goods (CPG) industry, with a focus on specialty retail channels.· Strong understanding of consumer behavior, retail trends, and merchandising best practices within the health and wellness industry.· Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build rapport and negotiate effectively with retail partners.· Strategic thinker with the ability to analyze data, identify opportunities, and develop actionable insights to drive sales growth.· Results-oriented mindset with a track record of achieving sales targets and driving revenue growth in a competitive market environment.· Entrepreneurial spirit, with a passion for innovation, creativity, and driving positive change in a dynamic business environment.
Benefits:· Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.· Opportunity to make a significant impact and drive growth in a rapidly expanding company.· Dynamic and collaborative work environment with a culture of innovation and excellence.· Opportunity for professional development and advancement within the organization.
Join Fit Butters and lead our efforts to enhance the consumer experience and drive sales growth within specialty retail channels. title: Assistant Director Distribution Total Rewards
description:
At Northwestern Mutual, we are strong, innovative and growing. We invest in our people. We care and make a positive difference.

Summary:

The Field Rewards team is responsible for leading the design of compensation, recognition and benefit programs to influence members of our distribution system. The programs and contracts this team designs and monitors are integral to the delivery of the company strategy and functional strategies, including growth of the distribution system, and as such require review of financial implications for the company, advisor, and field leader.

The Assistant Director supports the design of this work through consideration of financial implications and strategic analysis, compliance and legal implications, technology and administrative feasibility, risk and wealth product mechanics/priorities, field experience, and behavioral economics.

The Assistant Director will often lead implementation and execution of new programs and changes to existing programs.

This role will regularly partner with peers across the function and broader company and will frequently contribute to efforts involving senior leadership and key field advisors and leaders.

Primary Duties & Responsibilities:

Supports complex, cross-functional, and ambiguous initiatives that align to and drive the company strategy.

As a part of this work, may lead implementation and execution of program components or components of design.

Conducts complex analyses and modeling to support program design and program updates bringing together expertise related to financials, regulations, compliance, administration, product design, and field experience.

Manages the maintenance of existing programs (compensation, recognition, and benefits) to ensure they meet financial objectives, remain compliant with ever changing laws, align with the strategy, and achieve desired outcomes.

Analyzes requests for exceptions to guidelines and policies evaluating all variables, including impact to the system of one-off solutions.

Acts as key subject matter resource on risk product compensation, investment compensation, bonuses, field contracts, ensemble compensation, retirement benefits, medical benefits and other ancillary field benefits, and corporate recognition of advisors and field leaders.

Partners to translate program designs accurately and effectively into systems requirements and communications.

Builds understanding of competitive, regulatory, and economic environment shifts and changes and considers impact on Total Reward programs.

Supports development of team members through mentorship, guidance and coaching.

Builds and maintains relationships with cross-functional partners and field members.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, analytics, finance, accounting or actuarial science, or an equivalent combination of education and experience

7+ years progressively responsible work experiences, including leading initiatives, driving results with others, and performing financial and data analysis.

Ability to pull and present key insights from analysis that helps drive decisions or design for various audiences, including ability to express technical concepts in understandable language and deliver difficult messages in a empathic way.

Demonstrated ability to develop rapport and establish and maintain effective, cooperative, and supportive relationships at all levels in the Home Office and field.

Proven ability to influence others and build partnerships.

Intellectual agility, analytical and problem-solving abilities with a proven ability to develop creative solutions

Demonstrated ability working through ambiguity.

Expert at leveraging data and tools for research and analysis.

Three plus years of experience working with NM field force preferred.

> partially onsite, partially remote

Pay Range

Start:

$100,030.00

Pay Range

End:

$185,770.00

description:

title: Director of Finance
description:
Company Description
L+R Hotels is a dynamic, highly motivated global private investment company headquartered in London. With a diverse portfolio of 23,000 rooms across the UK, Continental Europe, the US, and the Caribbean, we manage select service hotels, award-winning five-star assets, and spectacular leisure resorts in exclusive locations. As committed owners, we invest with patient capital, prioritize long-term vision, and value our employees, guests, and investors.
Role Description
This is a full-time on-site role for a Director of Finance at Palm House in Palm Beach, FL. The relaunch of the all new Palm Beach icon will commence in Q4 2024, with all new rooms, suites, public space and signature celebrity dining, the property is set to be a new star on the revered Palm Beach hospitality scene. The Director of Sales Marketing will be responsible for day-to-day finance operations, accounts payable, accounts receivable, team management, audit and compliance as well as maintaining detailed records.
Qualifications
Preopening hotel/resort experience is a strong plusStrong Finance and balance sheet knowledgeExperience with reviewing and contracting servicesStrong customer service skillsExcellent communication and interpersonal skillsAbility to work well in a team and independentlyExperience in the hospitality industryExperience creating, implementing and administering experiential marketing campaigns
Competitive Compensation commensurate with experience and bonus potential.
Accounting & Control · Maintain accurate accounting records and provide financial reports for the hotel under the umbrella of the company accounting system. Comply with company timetables and policies.· Ensure that the balance sheet is a fair reflection of the assets and liabilities of the hotel. The balance sheet must be regularly reviewed and reconciliation’s performed of all accounts.· Maintain a focused system of internal controls, which will provide effective and efficient control over the hotel assets, liabilities, revenue and costs. Ensure compliance with company policy.· Liaise and co-operate with Internal Audit. Ensure that an effective program of in-hotel audit is in place and that corrective action is promptly taken where required. Particular emphasis to ensuring that all revenue is captured. Make use of a monthly control checklist.· Develop best practice financial accounting and control procedures. This must be an area of continuous review and development with the aim of maximizing both impact and efficiency.· Ensure that all purchasing within the hotel is carried out via purchase order system, and are signed as authorized by the General Manager & Finance Director. Reporting · Develop high quality management information and performance measurement that is timely, accurate. Reporting should be thought provoking and action oriented.· Utilize reporting that incorporates benchmarking, identification and measurement of key performance indicators. Reporting should not only look to historical performance within the hotel, but also outwards and forwards.· Understand and measure cost drivers for the hotel. Utilize innovative analysis to stimulate thought and management action.· Benchmark costs against other hotels. Identify cost reduction opportunities.  Forecast & Planning · Manage the formulation, review and approval process for budgeting within the hotel.· Ensure a regular cycle of forecasting takes place within the hotel with content and detail appropriate to the needs of the operation.· Utilize project evaluation techniques to assist in directing investment to those projects which optimize returns both for the individual project and the enterprise as a whole.· Prepare and review capital authorities, ensuring financial accuracy and sound commercial and business judgement are applied to the process, and that authorization is obtained prior to commitment of the hotel to expenditure. Business support · Support and advice on financial and commercial matters to the General Manager and to the hotel team, including the interpretation of financial data.· Review management information for the hotel and make proposals for the General Manager for value added initiatives. Challenge standard practices and proposals.· Provide financial and commercial skills to support business development initiatives, major pricing decisions and other commercial decision making.  Staffing · Recruit and retain the best people for the job. Make use of succession planning to develop and replace individuals effectively. Establish and maintain good employee relations within the Finance Department. · Aim to maximize efficiency in the accounting department. We should aim for optimum staffing levels. Recognize that a highly organized Accounts Office is often a sign of an efficient department.· To attend and ensure the department staff attends Fire/Health and Safety and any other training sessions as required of a statutory nature or the business, to assist in their personal development to meat the needs of the business.· To uphold best practice health and safety requirements of department and ensure regular risk assessments are undertaken e.g. working with VDU’s and ergonomic assessments.

title: Regional Sales Manager
description:
On behalf of our client, an innovative manufacturer of technologically advanced tube and sheet metal fabricating solutions, we are looking for an enthusiastic Regional Sales Manager.

Summary:

Territory – MN, ND, SD, Western WI. Cutting and Bending Machinery IndustryRemote in the Upper Mid-Western States listed. Sales, Business Development role. 


 Company:

Our client is a well-known European company that provides industry-leading manufacturing solutions for Tube Laser Cutting, Tube Bending, Flat Sheet Laser Cutting, and Bending. The US headquarters is in the Detroit Metro Area. The industry applications include Aerospace/Defense, Automotive, Furniture, HVAC, Structural/Architectural, Electronics, and Appliances, to mention a few. 


Brief:

As a Regional Sales Manager, you will strategically identify, engage, and cultivate relationships with manufacturers and fabricators in your assigned region, promoting and offering BLM's cutting-edge products and solutions. You will be responsible for reaching a yearly sales goal by uncovering the hidden needs of customers and prospects and providing the pertaining solutions. A strong problem-solving skill is highly desirable, with the ability to analyze manufacturing processes and identify opportunities by “connecting the dots”. In conjunction with your Manager, you will assist in planning and directing the sales strategies, objectives, and initiatives, including developing a sales plan to fulfill the growth and revenue goals. This role requires you to be a people person with strong attention to detail and the ability to provide creative solutions for complex manufacturing problems. With the company’s support, you will build and maintain successful customer relationships and ensure timely and accurate communication is handled with the utmost care both internally and externally. 

 Qualifications: 

BS in Engineering or Business Administration is a big plus · Work effectively and efficiently with minimal supervision (entrepreneurial spirit).5 years minimum of technical sales or application engineering experience.Previous experience in the cutting and bending machinery industry is a huge plus.Knowledge of American Standard to Metric Standard conversions.Must be able to adapt well to change and be very organized with the ability to handle multiple tasks and prioritize, with exceptional attention to detail.Travel – avg. 50% up to 70%

 Benefits include and are not limited to: Full-coverage Health insurance options. Company 401K (or Roth 401k) with a 6% employer match. Tuition reimbursement, employee suggestion program, newborn baby/family program.

title: Director, Marketing Science
description:
Overview

The Company

Hearts & Science has been inspired by confident marketers seeking business advantage in a world of personalized digital marketing, where CRM and addressable channels converge, and decisions must be made in real time to aggregate effective reach and deliver the right message at the right time.

Designed to inform brand strategies with real-time insights, Hearts & Science is a data-driven marketing agency with expert media planning and buying capabilities, among other services that include shopper marketing, marketing innovation and content activation.

Director, Marketing Science 

As a Director on our Marketing Science you will work in a matrixed environment within the MarSci and MarTech function across Hearts & Science. You will lead the insights and analytics practice related to your specific brand portfolio, partnering with the client service team and category leads in media strategy and investment. At your disposal will be wide range of highly skilled analytics and data science resources.

Qualifications

7+ years of experience at a media agency, marketing analytics firm or in a quantitative, data driven field, performance media a must2+ years of experience working with large client data set portfolios, delivering insight and trend recommendations and strategies2+ years of experience in consumer strategy, insights, or business intelligenceExcellent communication and presentation skills are a mustExcellent strategic thinker who is willing to take risks and challenge the status quoStrong leader who can demonstrate analytic skills, problem solving, and independent decision makingAbility to clearly explain complex ideas to multiple audiences and respond to questionsFamiliarity with marketing technology (e.g. Data Management Platforms), ad-serving (e.g. Google DCM, Atlas), and web analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics)Knowledge and experience with syndicated research sources/tools (e.g. ComScore, Nielsen, GfK MRI, Simmons, etc.)Experience with marketing mix modeling/econometric analysis and/or other branches of market research (custom survey research, advertising testing or tracking, new product research, etc.)


Knowledge & Skills

Forward Thinking - a desire to challenge yourself, strategy teams and our clients to think beyond today’s solutions.Creativity - an ability to think and solve problems in non-linear ways, and an ability to craft compelling stories.Curiosity - a natural and persistent inclination to explore, discover, and learn, and a general fascination with analytics.Agility - the nimbleness to react to market changes and high value opportunities.Persistence - the drive to go beyond asking “what?” to ask “why?”; a commitment to digging beneath the surfaces and interrogating information versus accepting it at face value.Resourcefulness - an ability to look beyond the usual sources and insight opportunities to find a solution when time and dollars are limited.Confidence - a willingness to share opinions and present recommendations with conviction.Collaboration - a desire to create a collaborative working environment where the notion of team comes before labels. 


Responsibilities

Translate data into clear, compelling, and actionable insights by leveraging advanced analytics tactics conducted by central resourcesCollaborate with marketing and media partners and strategy teams to understand business and marketing objectives and develop analytics approaches to meet those objectivesPresent to clients, with the support of the functional specialists, the results of analyses and research projects in a clear and insightful narrative, digestible by a lay personLead understanding of customer audiences and marketplace behaviors, particularly those that most impact business and marketing goalsWith the leaders of the functional specialty teams, keep track of projects being run by the Functional Specialists to ensure they are done on time and to right level of qualitySupport new business efforts including development of the strategy, creation of the pitch story, and participation in the presentations Evaluate data and research/analytics vendors for client needs or as they approach clientsWork with third party research/analytics vendors to design and set up projects for clients Aid in the development and execution of the measurement planCreate specific research awards submissions and contribute to strategy awards submissions 


Compensation Range: $100,000 - $150,000 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on relevant experience, other job-related qualifications/skills, and geographic location (to account for comparative cost of living). The Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, Benefits include: health insurance, vision insurance, dental insurance, 401(k), Healthcare Flexible Spending Account, Dependence Care Flexible Spending Account, vacation, sick, personal days, paid parental leave, and paid medical leave, STD/LTD insurance benefits.

Hearts & Science is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. title: Chief Development Officer
description:
A faith-based nonprofit located in Central Indiana seeks an ambitious, experienced and entrepreneurial fundraising professional to serve as its Chief Development Officer.
ABOUT USOur holistic care is focused on helping every individual invest in themselves, empowering them to make wise decisions and find healing based on education, truth, and compassion. We strive to help everyone experience the freedom needed to build a healthy foundation and realize the value of every aspect of life.
We are a US 501(c) (3) faith-based nonprofit with an annual budget of $5 Million USD.
POSITION PURPOSEYour role is vital to the work of our organization as we come alongside those in our community who are struggling, uncertain, scared, and insecure to provide help, healing, and hope.
We are seeking an entrepreneurial and mission-driven Chief Development Officer (CDO) to lead the strategic direction and day-to-day operations of its development department. The CDO will work directly with the organization’s leadership to nurture existing relationships, engage and solicit new corporate partners, and over the long term to develop a strategy to diversify funding streams to include revenue sources such as individual donors, government grants, and private foundations. The CDO will serve on the executive leadership team and will supervise the development team. The new CDO will bring a well-rounded understanding of fundraising strategy and best practices and a proven track record of crafting and leading the successful implementation of a comprehensive fundraising program. They will have exceptional interpersonal and communications skills, thrive in a fast-paced environment, will be able to lead both strategy and execution, and are highly skilled at managing people and initiatives with confidence, gravitas, and efficacy.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIESThe Chief Development Officer will report to and work closely with the CEO and oversee all fundraising activities of the organization from strategy development to implementation, solicitation, diversifying funding streams, and analysis. Priority areas of focus include stewarding relationships with current donors, securing grants and managing relationships, building new partnerships with diversified funders with a state- wide strategy in mind, increasing major giving and individual support, strategic oversight of sponsorships, and in-kind contributions; familiarity with all fundraising tactics and revenue sources is desired.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:Development and implementation of a comprehensive fundraising strategy to secure, retain and grow revenue from all sources, including corporations, foundations, government grants, individuals, and events to secure cash contributions of $5+ million annually.Establishment and management of goals and department budget.Integration of digital fundraising strategies, including understanding and use of metrics to analyze and inform strategies.Oversight of the fundraising program, including setting metrics and benchmarks by which success will be measured and proven ability to pivot and change strategy as needed.Working closely with the finance and affiliate impact staff, maintaining an accurate understanding of organizational priorities, revenue status, cash flow, and use of funds in keeping with donor intent.Development and implementation of strategy to secure and manage in-kind product donationsPartnering with CEO, board, and senior staff to manage relationships with major donors and prospects.Leadership of the team members in the development department to include recruitment, mentorship, supervision, and development of team members.Spearheading efforts to grow monthly giving program. Evaluate and refine current campaigns to optimize revenue potential and brand awareness.
KEY QUALIFICATIONSDemonstrated experience in developing and executing a comprehensive and diversified fundraising strategy with attention to donor acquisition, digital strategies, retention, stewardship, and revenue growth.Minimum of 10 years of fundraising experience, including experience in a related senior management role.Results-driven approach to the work with demonstrated success securing 6+-figure gifts from diverse sources including corporations, foundations, individuals, and through special event sponsorships.Proven success in building and sustaining a philanthropic level major gifts program with large-scale donor solicitation.Exceptional relationship management and comfort networking and fostering partnerships with both corporations and individuals.Extraordinary communicator (written and oral) with an ability to effectively sell the organization to donors and partners.Demonstrated success in leading teams and driving results; excellence in building teams and motivating and developing employees.Computer savvy and comfortable using financial reports, data, and analytics to inform decisions.Organized and adaptable individual who can move fluidly between managing the work and doing the work as part of a small team.Collaborative relationship building both internally and externally.Bachelor’s degree preferred; additional professional certification(s) in fundraising from recognized organizations a plus.

title: General Manager Distribution
industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Position Description: 
The Distribution Excellence Manager is responsible for overseeing all operational and administrative facets of the Distribution Center (DC) to ensure compliance with all Company guidelines, policies and federal and state regulations. The Distribution Excellence Manager is accountable for delivering performance in: safety, quality, on time and accurate delivery, cost, while coaching and managing the talent of their team. Ensures returned goods and customers credits are applied in a timely manner. Delivery: Engages drivers and warehouse staff to ensure on-time and complete deliveriesCost: Reviews and manages DC cost productivity, driving toward efficient labor and delivery costs per unit handled and delivered. Manage DC expenses to achieve monthly and annual budget/plan as assigned by the Company.People: Develop and lead talent within the DC. Plan, develop and implement people strategy in conjunction with Company for talent management and development, including recruitment, selection, disciplinary procedures, grievances, counseling, pay and conditions, training and development, succession planning, morale and motivation, culture and attitudinal development and performance evaluations.Compliance: Ensure full compliance with OSHA, DOT, ADA and other governmental regulatory agencies while complying with Company policies concerning health and safety.Team leadership: Lead daily and weekly meetings with staff to identify and address issues and communicate messages and relevant changes from other parts of the Company. Reporting and tracking: Develop, update, and share regular reports of DC performance with key identified partners. Serve as the on-site inventory control expert.Direct Reports:Distribution Center SupervisorDistribution Center LeadDriversWarehouse AssociatesDistribution Center Support CoordinatorKey Partners (Positions):Regional Supply Chain DirectorRegion PresidentDirector of SalesHuman Resource DirectorRegion Market SpecialistCCS/CSRSafety LeadershipTransportation LeadershipExperience(s) that Best Prepares You:Education: Minimum high school graduate or GED; preferred Bachelor’s degree from 4-year college, or equivalent work experienceExperience: 5-8 years experience managing in a high volume, low margin, high customer service distribution environment required. Thorough understanding of supply chain, distribution, warehouse, transportation, and inventory. Thorough understanding of P&L statements and OPEX costing structures. Demonstrated people skills including influencing skills, listening and the ability to communicate effectively to diverse groups.Such alternatives to the above qualifications as the company, in its discretion, may find appropriate and acceptable.
Key Competencies:
Distribution and Processing -- Knowledge of materials, warehouse processes, quality control, costs, and other techniques for maximizing the effective distribution of goods.Administration and Management -- Knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, human resources modeling, leadership technique, production methods, and coordination of people and resources.Developing and Building Teams -- Encouraging and building mutual trust, respect, and cooperation among team members.Judgment and Decision Making -- Considering the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one.Management of Financial Resources -- Determining how money will be spent to get the work done, in the most cost effective manner available, and accounting for these expenditures.Evaluating Information to Determine Compliance with Standards -- Using relevant information and individual judgment to determine whether events or processes comply with laws, regulations, or standards.Coaching and Developing Others -- Identifying the developmental needs of others and coaching, mentoring, or otherwise help others to improve their knowledge or skills.Oral Expression and Comprehension -- The ability to communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand.Written Expression -- The ability to communicate information and ideas in writing so others will understand.Reading Comprehension -- Understanding written sentences and paragraphs in work related documents.Basic math - Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commission proportions, percentages and area.
