Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.Work environment: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is exposed to weather conditions prevalent at the time. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.Travel required: Travel as required throughout the geographic area within the assigned region, with up to 10% overnight stays.

title: Supervisory Logistics Management Specialist
description:
Come be a part of something big! Smart Minds, Cool Jobs, and Awesome Rewards! Fueled by innovation, talent and ambition, the Air Force Civilian Service (AFCS) is seeking civilian professionals prepared to deploy war-winning capabilities on behalf of the United States Air Force. 
Air Force Nuclear Weapons Center is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We foster a culture and workforce based on merit, dignity, and respect where every employee (or Airman) feels accepted, valued, and has the opportunity to accomplish the mission.

OPENS: 19 APRIL 2024CLOSES: 5 MAY 2024

Air Force Civilian Service is currently seeking a full-time Supervisory Logistics Management Specialist to work in the Air Force Nuclear Weapons Center, Minuteman III (MMIII) Systems Directorate, Propulsion Division at Hill Air Force Base near Layton, Utah. 

This position (206014) is an NH-346-04, which has a typical 2024 salary range of $122,198 - $186,854.

This position is not eligible for remote or full-time telework; situational-based agreements may be available at the discretion of the hiring manager.


The AFNWC Minuteman III Systems Directorate manages the current Intercontinental Ballistic Missile (ICBM) technical integrated life-cycle activities, including equipment spares, storage and transportation, modifications, and equipment replacement. America’s nuclear triad remains capable, flexible, resilient and ready, but it must be continually modernized to maintain a credible deterrent against current and emerging threats. This position plays an important role in providing a strategic deterrent to nuclear attack against the United States.


The primary purpose of this position is to serve as the Minuteman III Propulsion Division Chief responsible for the successful execution of the MMIII Propulsion programs to include Booster Programmed Depot Maintenance (PDM), Propulsion Solid Rocket Engine (PSRE) PDM, Stage One Flight Control Battery Replacement, as well as risk management for viability of the Propulsion subsystem through end of life MMIII. 


DUTIES:Serves as MMIII Propulsion Division Chief as described above.Serves as the Propulsion Integrated Product Team (IPT) lead to sustain field worthy assets until a suitable replacement for the MMIII weapon system is fielded; develops and successfully executes Propulsion IPT-related objectives and key results to support Propulsion critical Lines of Effort.Represents the MMIII Propulsion Division within the government and to contractor/industry representatives; delivers presentations on project/program status, accomplishments, challenges encountered and anticipated, support requirements, and the integration and advocacy of program and project objectives.Provides direction to the Subsystem Support Contract Program Manager and the Integrated Support Contract Program Manager in support of the MMIII Propulsion sub-systems. Provides continuous assessment/evaluation of overall Propulsion program goals, objectives, strategies and performance to ensure a sound basis for follow-on ICBM system life-cycle support planning. Ensures that programmatic issues concerning the welfare of each Propulsion sub-system are addressed and the relevant risks are mitigated within a timely manner.Performs typical supervisory and personnel management tasks: assigns and manages work within the Division; acquires necessary resources to accomplish the mission; sets and adjusts short/long-term priorities: and provides feedback and evaluations for assigned employees.



SKILLS:Typically, four (4) or more years of progressively complex life-cycle logistics management experience is preferred at this level for NH-346-04 positions.Refined communication and teamwork skills sufficient to effectively interface with internal and external stakeholders at all levels, as well as the independence, assertiveness, self-reliance, and tenacity to get the job done are typically desired to successfully perform the duties of this position.Experience in mentoring, leading and/or supervising others is highly valued.Experience leading diverse working groups or teams and setting clear mission objectives to achieve desired results and outcomes is highly desired. Understanding of DoD weapon systems issues, and experience working with government organizations in areas such as acquisition, production, maintenance, repair, life-cycle logistics, engineering support, testing and evaluation, or other sustainment activities is strongly preferred. Experience with ICBMs, particularly MMIII propulsion systems, is ideal.



REQUIREMENTS FOR THE POSITION:U.S. CITIZENSHIP Employee must be able to obtain and maintain a Top Secret/SCI security clearance and will be required to handle and safeguard sensitive and/or classified information in accordance with regulations to reduce potential compromise. Employee must meet Defense Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act (DAWIA) requirements, which includes achieving Lifecycle Logistics Management “Advanced” certification category within required timeframe after appointment.This is a Critical Acquisition Position (CAP). Unless specifically waived by the appropriate component official, i.e., the Director of Acquisition Career Management for the component, the Service Acquisition Executive, or the Service Secretary, the following are statutorily mandated requirements. (1) Selectee must be a member of an Acquisition Corps, be able to obtain membership within six months IAW 10 USC 1733 and 1737, or secure an approved position requirements waiver prior to assignment unless they meet all the requirements for membership except grade. (2) Selectee must execute, as a condition of employment, a written agreement to remain in federal service in this position for at least three years. In signing such agreement, the employee does not forfeit any employment rights, nor does such agreement alter any other terms or conditions of employment. (3) Selectee must meet advanced certification requirements or be able to meet them within 24 months of assignment (with a waiver). (4) This position also requires the employee to engage in acquisition continuous learning activities achieving 80 Continuous Learning Points every 24 months. In accordance with the Ethics in Government Act, 1978, employee may be required to file an Office of Government Ethics (OGE) Form 450, Confidential Financial Disclosure Report, upon appointment and will be required to file annually.

HOW TO APPLY:When applying at the link below, please use Microsoft Edge or Google Chrome. Click the apply button to complete an application and upload resume (PDF or Word format) and any additional documents (e.g., certifications, professional references, DD214, SF-50, etc.).**IMPORTANT**Please submit your resume and supporting documents in MS Word or PDF format.If using Microsoft Word, you must use 2018 or a more recent version, as MS Word 97-2003 documents are no longer viewable on Department of Defense computer systems.Your resume is key to evaluating your skills, knowledge, and abilities; be clear and specific when describing experience to improve your chances of getting an interview. Candidates should provide three professional references on their resume or download their professional references on a document when applying on Salesforce.3.Permanent Change of Station (PCS) will be covered. Recruitment incentives/relocation expenses may be covered by a case-by-case basis.4. To find all current job and internship opportunities at the Air Force Nuclear Weapons Center, visit the AFNWC webpage at: https://www.afnwc.af.mil/About-Us/Jobs/.5. To receive additional information about current and future job openings with AFCS via email notification, please subscribe at www.Afciviliancareers.com and sign up to “Get Career Updates.”

U.S. citizenship required. AFCS is Equal Opportunity Employer. Must be of legal working age.

Our premier services, including Advanced Analytics Solutions, Insight Platforms, and Custom Data Services, employ cutting-edge technology and in-depth analysis to ensure our clients' success in their respective fields.Position Overview: In the role of Product Strategy Lead for our B2B solutions, you will guide a talented team dedicated to developing and refining digital tools designed for top-performing organizations. This role is pivotal in driving forward business objectives, spurring innovation, and delivering impactful solutions tailored to the needs of our clientele. We value strong leadership, strategic insight, and a comprehensive understanding of product development processes.Core Responsibilities:Team Development:Direct and nurture a group of skilled product strategists, encouraging their career advancement.Oversee all aspects of the product strategist team's development, from recruitment to professional growth.Cultivate a culture of excellence, innovation, and collaboration within the team.Strategic Development & Execution:Establish the strategic vision and developmental roadmap for our flagship solutions, aligning with the company's broad goals.Coordinate with various departments to prioritize projects, efficiently manage resources, and ensure the delivery of top-quality solutions.Utilize iterative testing and data insights to refine product features, enhance user engagement, and promote continuous innovation.Relationship and Stakeholder Management:Collaborate with company leadership to define and implement strategic initiatives, influencing the direction of senior management.Act as a key advisor on product strategy, industry trends, and the competitive landscape.Strengthen relationships with essential stakeholders, including teams, partners, and clients, to collect valuable feedback and inform product advancements.Performance Analysis and Enhancement:Monitor essential metrics to evaluate product performance, aligning team efforts with strategic objectives.Lead optimization efforts through analytical reviews, customer insights, and market studies, improving product offerings to meet the evolving needs of our clients.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or a similar field; a Master's degree or MBA is preferred.At least 5-6 years of experience in product strategy or management, with a proven track record of launching successful digital products or services.Experience in analytics and strategy, preferably with familiarity in our specific data analysis tools.Demonstrated leadership skills, with experience in leading high-achieving teams in product strategy or related fields.Exceptional communication and team-building abilities, capable of inspiring diverse teams and influencing key stakeholders.A deep-rooted passion for innovation, with a commitment to driving advancements in data analysis and strategic planning across industries.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
Senior DevOps Engineer
DevOps Engineer is responsible for managing and optimizing our cloud infrastructure, building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines, and ensuring the reliability and security of our cloud-based applications. DevOps Engineer will work closely with development and operations teams to streamline deployment processes and implement best practices for cloud management and DevOps. 
Let Us Introduce Ourselves....
We’re a team of driven, conscientious individuals with a clear mission: to make accounting and payroll fast, simple, and affordable for millions of American businesses and their accountants. 
It’s not enough to have a “good job”. It takes connection, culture, encouragement, growth opportunities, challenges, communication, and so much more to create an environment where people and ideas flourish. 
We are Patriot Software; a fully remote company with 175+ employees across the United States and a co-working space in Canton, Ohio. 
Our search for a new team member always starts by seeking a quality individual who desires to live by our core values:
Be Customer ObsessedLead With SpeedDon’t Cut CornersCreate a Better UsFollow The Golden RuleGrow, Be a Leader
Interested in learning more? Great! Read on to see if your skills are a match, too. 
What You’ll Be Doing: 
Key Responsibilities:
AWS Infrastructure Management:Create, configure, and maintain AWS infrastructure resources using AWS CDK.Monitor and optimize AWS resources for cost efficiency and performance.Cloudflare Configuration:Configure and manage Cloudflare services for enhanced security, performance, and CDN management.Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD):Design and implement CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins, GitHub Actions, and TeamCity.Automate the build, test, and deployment processes to ensure rapid and reliable software delivery.Version Control:Administer and maintain Git repositories on GitHub.Ensure the proper version control and branching strategies are in place.Kubernetes and EKS:Deploy and manage containerized applications on Amazon EKS.Configure and scale Kubernetes clusters for high availability and performance.Infrastructure as Code (IaC):Develop and manage Infrastructure as Code using tools like Terraform, AWS CDK, or CloudFormation.Security and Compliance:Implement and maintain security best practices in the cloud infrastructure.Ensure compliance with industry standards and company policies.Networking:Design, implement, and maintain network architectures within AWS including VPC, subnets, NAT, VPN, and route tables.Configure and manage AWS Transit Gateway.Optimize network performance by configuring AWS Route 53 and other network services.Secure network infrastructure by implementing network firewalls, ACLs, and security groups.Monitoring and Logging:Set up monitoring and logging solutions to proactively identify and resolve issues.Respond to incidents and troubleshoot production problems.Collaboration:Collaborate with development teams to understand their needs and provide DevOps support.Work with cross-functional teams to improve the development and deployment process.
Please note this is a sample of what you’ll be doing. This job requires you to be able to adapt to change quickly in order to deliver an exceptional customer experience. Your duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
What You’ll Need: 
Previous experience in a Senior DevOps Engineer role7+ years of previous experience in DevOpsProficient in creating, configuring, and maintaining AWS infrastructure resources using AWS CDK.Ability to monitor and optimize AWS resources for cost efficiency and performance.Experience in configuring and managing Cloudflare services for enhanced security, performance, and CDN management.Design and implementation of CI/CD pipelines using tools such as Jenkins and GitHub Actions.Automation skills for building, testing, and deploying processes to ensure rapid and reliable software delivery.Experience in administration and maintenance of Git repositories on GitHub.Ability to deploy and manage containerized applications on Amazon EKS.Proficient in configuring and scaling Kubernetes clusters for high availability and performance.Experience in developing and managing Infrastructure as Code using tools like Terraform, AWS CDK, or CloudFormation.Strong networking skills with extensive experience in VPC configurations, Transit Gateway setups, and network optimization within a cloud environment.Collaborative skills to work with development teams, understanding their needs, and providing DevOps support.Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams to enhance the development and deployment processes.A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Location & Commitments:Full-time, Direct Hire and 100% Remote role
This position is open to all candidates who legally reside and are eligible to work in the United States. This position is currently not open to applicants in the following locations: Alaska, California, Hawaii, Washington D.C.
Working hours are established by each team and department based on business needs. For this role, core working hours are typically between 8am - 5pm EST, Monday through Friday. Due to the nature of our businesses, we have busy seasons and “right-nows” that occasionally require working outside of core hours.
Patriot is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, color, gender, national origin, age, religion, creed, disability or sex.
More Reasons to Love Patriot:We pride ourselves on our company culture and value our employees’ hard work. Aside from the freedom to introduce new ideas or technologies, here are some of the awesome benefits our full-time employees enjoy:
Paid time off and paid holidaysMedical, dental, and vision insurance Section 125 HSA and FSA accountsBenefits starting 1st of the month after hireCompany-paid life, short-term, and long-term disability insurance401(k) with company matchUp-to-date hardware and equipment providedFlexible scheduling and opportunities for advancementEngaging and collaborative company cultureEducation reimbursement 
Are you ready to take the next step in your career?
Salary Range: $130K - $155K

title: Landscape Designer/Sales Associate
description:
POSITION TITLE: Landscape Designer/Sales AssociateSUPERVISOR'S TITLE: Director of Design and SalesDEPARTMENT: Design/SalesFLSA Status: Exempt
BPI Outdoor Living is an award-winning, privately-owned Landscape Design/Build Firm located in Indianapolis, Indiana. The primary focus of BPI is collaborating with residential clients to design and construct award winning outdoor living spaces and landscapes that enhance their lifestyles and property values. BPI is looking for a career minded individual that is eager to learn and advance in our growing company. The Landscape Designer/Sales Associate will ensure that our client’s needs and desires are being met while also ensuring that BPI’s vision and mission are being fulfilled. You’ll play a crucial role in assisting the design and sales team as well as acting as a trusted advisor to help our clients realize the full potential for their outdoor living spaces and landscapes. You will work closely with a talented team of designers and craftsmen to allow our collaborative vision for our client’s spaces come to life the way we intended. Our talented design team consists of skilled designers, computer savvy individuals and amazing graphic artists. Working with this team will allow for you to be part of award-winning designs and finished projects. Our ability to create trust with clients and define unique, elegant, and functional design solutions allow us to build their spaces typically within a year of the initial designs. This will allow you to be a part of some amazing builds and allow for exposure to new installation techniques.
Think you’re a good “fit”? You will need to bring the following: · Ability to meet with clients and determine unique and functional design solutions based on their needs, desires and budget.· Strong communication skills and the ability to act in a consultative and prescriptive manner. · Collaborate with a team of designers and project managers on project details and deadlines. · Ability to communicate with the team and clients using graphics and renderings. · Understand construction documentation and possess the ability to create production packages. · Effectively communicate with client and team members throughout the design and installation process. · Knowledge of required permitting and construction compliance. · A Bachelor’s degree in Landscape Architecture. · More than three years of professional experience in a landscape architecture/design role. · Previous experience in a sales and performance-driven setting would help you and us. We’re committed to your success, and you’ll find opportunities to grow here with us. You won’t find a corporate ladder to climb, but rather a chance to evolve your skills and abilities as we grow. We’ll give you the tools that you need to excel - we just need you to tell us what you need and why it will help you and the business.

EXPECTATIONS AND ROCKSWithin the first three to six months, this position would accomplish the following “rocks”.· Demonstrate the ability to design unique, functional outdoor spaces based on the client’s needs, desires and budget while maintaining profitability.· Meet or exceed initial sales goals and metrics.· Forge relationships with the production team and ensure the company’s vision and mission are being upheld.
POSITION PURPOSETo act as a trusted expert for our clients. To offer unique, and functional design solutions for their outdoor living spaces and landscapes while be thoughtful about their budgets and investments in their properties. To work with our production team to ensure the overall vision for the outdoor living space is realized. POSITION ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIESTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS· Meets with clients to define realistic, unique and functional design solutions.· Meets or exceeds sales goals.· Creates construction documentation and supporting design details for permit requirements.· Collaborates with the production team to ensure the clients expectations and vision are being met.  EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCETo perform this job successfully, an individual must have the following education and/or experience.· Bachelor’s degree in Landscape Architecture.· Three or more years of Landscape Architecture or Design experience.· Professional registration in Landscape Architecture is preferred.· Previous experience in a sales and performance-driven setting is preferred.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIESThe requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.· Efficient in AutoCAD· Basic understanding in Sketchup· Willingness to take on new challenges and responsibilities· Good organization and comfort following a process· Highly motivated and energetic· Strong sense of urgency and problem-solving skills· Strong work ethic
WORKING CONDITIONS AND BENEFITS●  Paid Holidays and PTO package● Health Insurance● Long Term Disability Insurance● Life Insurance● Company Take Home Vehicle● Company matched Simple IRA● Company issued Technology package

title: Associate Director, Social
description:

Possessing capability to tell a story through analyzing and applying data trendsConstructing data driven decks that display performance and optimization/future planning considerationsRecommending innovative strategic and media tactics consistent with media and content briefingBuilding and maintaining strong relationships with vendors, including Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Snapchat, etc.Working closely with the Digital and Strategy leads to foster synergies between social and digital opportunitiesProactively seeking out for media opportunities and/or industry news to develop sharp and up-to-date approach to media planning, and disseminate across the teamWorking together with the management to identify and grow incremental business opportunitiesHelping identify test and learn opportunities in line with client business objectives

title: Financial Aid Specialist
description:
JOB TITLE: FINANCIAL AID SPECIALIST DEPARTMENT: FINANCIAL AID

SALARY RANGE: $35,000 - $40,000 FLSA: NON-EXEMPT

IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR: Assistant Director of Federal Programs

SCHEDULE DETAILS: Full-time/12-month position/PEERS

Office hours are 7:30 a.m. – 5:30 p.m., Monday through Thursday, and 8:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m. on Friday. Flexibility to work any shift within these hours is required. Occasional evening and weekend work is also required.

Position Summary

The Financial Aid Specialist is responsible for assisting staff, faculty, and students regarding federal, state, and institutional financial aid programs in all facets from the application process through the status of the program and availability of funding via chat, email, phone or in person. The Financial Aid Specialist responsibilities will also include preparing, reviewing, maintaining, and transmitting records, forms, and documents, preparing, and sending correspondence and reports.

Essential Job Duties

Monitor and process verification, professional judgement, satisfactory academic progress queues to ensure timely completion.Monitor chats and emails to ensure timely replies and incident resolution.Facilitate communication with various agencies by using software and database systems to create, modify, extract, transmit, receive, and maintain financial aid records. Understand and apply IRS regulations as they pertain to the administration of Student Financial Aid programs. Review, track, and process incoming documents for accuracy. Monitor and process specialty documents to include employee tuition waivers, federal work study and federal direct loans as well as the various state aid programs. Communicate accurate financial aid information to faculty, staff, and students.Promote financial literacy and support staff and students with money management skills. Assure compliance with applicable regulations, laws, and policies by monitoring eligibility constraints, review processes for errors, resolve discrepancies, and make adjustments, corrections, and modifications in an effort to limit student and college liabilities. Maintain competency and professional development through self-directed professional reading, developing professional contacts with colleagues, attending professional development offerings, and attending training and/or courses required by the College Director of Financial Aid.Works independently to troubleshoot problems and recommend solutions.Translate federal regulations into logical processes.Support in accessing student emergency assistance programs. Ensure the Financial Aid office operates at a high level to provide superior customer service.Provide support for effective use of financial aid system software for staff and students.Shape department policies and procedures through direct feedback to department management. Exhibit exemplary attendance and punctuality. Comply with college policies and procedures. Perform other duties as assigned, including attending college functions, serving on committees, and attending community events. Attend community/professional events as requested. Perform assigned responsibilities, duties, and tasks according to established practices, procedures, techniques, and standards in a safe manner and with minimal supervision.

Required Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

Associate degree from a regionally accredited institution of higher learning and two (2) years of student affairs experience, or a bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited institution of higher learning.Excellent organizational skills with the ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.Ability to work well with others.Strong oral and written communication skills.Ability to use information technology for professional productivity (such as Microsoft Office Suite).

Preferred Knowledge Skills & Abilities

One year of experience in student financial aid programs, including knowledge of state and federal regulations on student financial aid administration.Three years of experience and skill in customer service.Experience and skill in public speaking.Experience with Colleague.Experience working within a collegiate setting.

Working At Ozarks Technical Community College Provides Great Benefits

Medical insurance coverage for employees through the CoxHealth network at no cost to employees.Dental, LTD and group life insurance coverage for employees at no cost to employees.Access to the on-site OTC Health and Wellness Clinic at no cost for employees and their dependents.Use of the OTC fitness center at no cost to employees.Twelve (12) tuition free college credit hours per fall and/or spring semester and six (6) college credit hours per summer term for employees and/or their dependents.College matches the employee PSRS/PEERS retirement at 14.5% or 6.86%

Physical Requirements

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, stand, and walk; use hands to finger/touch, handle, or feel; and talk or hear. The employee must be able to move around and about their area, and operate a computer as needed. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision.

title: Construction Superintendent
description: The ideal candidate for the position of Superintendent will be passionate about construction and desires to develop their career in a rapidly growing company. A working knowledge of GAAP and tax accounting for investments.

Ability to work well in a team environment

title: Associate Director, Marketing Science

Overview

The Company

Hearts & Science has been inspired by confident marketers seeking business advantage in a world of personalized digital marketing, where CRM and addressable channels converge, and decisions must be made in real time to aggregate effective reach and deliver the right message at the right time.

Designed to inform brand strategies with real-time insights, Hearts & Science is a data-driven marketing agency with expert media planning and buying capabilities, among other services that include shopper marketing, marketing innovation and content activation.

Associate Director, Marketing Science

As an Associate Director on the Marketing Science team, you will develop actionable insights through quantitative analysis, innovative thinking, and your industry knowledge to be a key contributor to tactical and strategic efforts. You will use your strong analytic and technical knowledge to evolve campaign and strategic deliverables that meet our client’s business needs. Oversee automation and improve processes for efficienciesBenchmarks & Goals: Set benchmarks and targets based on historical campaign data.Measurement: Develop a breadth of knowledge measurement strategy, frameworks, and technology (MMM/MTA).Data Quality: Be accountable for the maintenance and QA of data systems and processes used for reporting and ongoing data analysis.Coach and develop direct reports


Compensation Range: $75,000 - $130,000 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on relevant experience, other job-related qualifications/skills, and geographic location (to account for comparative cost of living). The Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, Benefits include: health/vision/dental insurance, 401(k), Healthcare Flexible Spending Account, Dependence Care Flexible Spending Account, vacation, sick, personal days, paid parental leave, and paid medical leave, STD/LTD insurance benefits.

title: Compliance Audit Associate
description:
COMPLIANCE AUDIT ASSOCIATE SUMMARY:The Compliance Audit Associate will play a crucial role in ensuring that PCI adheres to internal policies. This role is responsible for conducting audits and analyzing processes to identify areas of non-compliance. The Compliance Audit Associate will work with internal stakeholders to ensure corrective action plans are put in place to ensure PCI adheres to its Values, Mission, Vision (VMV).
WHO WE ARE:PCI starting in 1982, with a mission to offer financing to the unique needs of the direct sales industry, PCI is one of the nation’s leading indirect consumer lenders. PCI remains a stable, mid-sized, family-owned business and has an unwavering passion for service, trust, community, and growth.
COMPLIANCE AUDIT ASSOCIATE RESPONSIBILITIES: Collects, analyzes, and summarizes internal records, reports, procedures, and other relevant documentation to identify compliance issues.Prepares various reports to showcase audit findings, failed processes, corrective actions, progress, and re-validations.Documents audit findings, including deviates from policies or regulations.Collaborates with cross-functional teams to effectively implement corrective actions and remediation plans.Conducts follow-up audits to monitor progress of corrective actions and recommendations for improvement.
COMPLIANCE AUDIT ASSOCIATE QUALIFICATIONS:RequiredHigh School Diploma or a minimum of 4 years equivalent experience.Minimum of 1-year relevant work experience in Accounting, Data Collecting, or Analyst duties.Previous customer service experience.Knowledge in Microsoft Office, specifically Word and Excel.Must be reliable & efficient with time management.PreferredPrevious experience in a call center environment.Previous experience with a Finance background.Proficient in Excel graphs, specifically read, create, and adjust graphs.Understanding Pivot Tables.
OFFICE LOCATION: 628 Roosevelt Road, St. Cloud, MN
COMPLIANCE AUDIT ASSOCIATE SCHEDULE/HOURS:Full-Time, 40 Hours/weekMonday-Friday, 8:00am-5:00pm
COMPLIANCE AUDIT ASSOCIATE COMPENSATION:Up to $24.00/hour, Starting Pay Based on Experience 
BENEFITS: PCI has standard and competitive benefit plans, which include group medical/dental/vision, short term disability, long term disability as well as an attractive group of voluntary benefits. To learn more about our benefits, visit our website and click here.
Looking for some BENEFITS that are Above & Beyond?PCI will match 100% of your 401k deferrals up to 5%Annual Discretionary Bonus8 Paid Holidays Tuition Reimbursement Student Loan Match Program Paid Maternity and Paternity LeavePaid Time Off (PTO) Donation Matching & Paid Volunteer Time 
WHY WORK FOR PCI?Work In A Positive and Diverse Environment:We are a workplace that fosters appreciation, growth, diversity, and inclusiveness. We strive to be a relationship-driven company by building a community of positivity driven by the people we hire. PCI provides a positive work environment by ensuring a bright, clean, technology-forward in-person office space to enhance employee morale and on-the-phone customer interaction.Make A Difference:At PCI, our Values come first and part of our Values state, “As Stewards, we create value through competency, consistency and commitment”. Part of that commitment is the commitment we have to our community. When you join our team, you become part of a company that celebrates giving back. We partner with local nonprofit organizations and are proud to give back when and where we can. We have multiple benefits that help our employees further support and make a difference in our communities.Start Your Path To Success:We strive to create an engaging work environment at PCI; where employees feel they have a voice and a place within the company. In doing so, we encourage career growth by providing employees with the resources and services they need to take the next step in their careers. We take great pride in our ability to promote motivated and successful team members to other positions within the company.
EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY:PCI is an equal employment opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We make hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to disability, please contact PCI HR at HumanResources@preferredcredit.com.

title: Business Development Manager
description:
Do you thrive at uncovering new business prospects and building strong relationships?
If you are energized by the challenge of driving business success, this could be a terrific opportunity for you!
Due to growth, we are currently seeking a self-motivated, results-oriented individual as a Business Development Representative in the Eatonton, Milledgeville, and Gray areas.
We are proud to offer:range: $60,000 - $120,000 / yearplus uncapped commissiondental, and vision insurancewith company contribution and matchtime offtrainingopportunitiesworkplace
In this key telecommunications sales position, you will be responsible for providing direct Commercial/Enterprise sales for Tri-CoGo, the broadband subsidiary of Tri-County EMC. This includes prospecting, contacting prospective clients, identifying needs and solutions for the client/prospective client, scheduling appointments, and closing sales. The priority for this position is to increase the customer base and revenue for Tri-CoGo.
Business Development Representative Responsibilities:Identify prospective clients using database resources both within and adjacent to the fiber affiliate and electric cooperative’s territory.Work with sales and network operation team to understand customer needs, routinely analyzing ongoing market conditions, competitor activities, and other intelligence to adjust marketing plans, as necessary.Collaborate with Tri-CoGo Marketing Coordinator to generate promotional, branding, and customer education collateral to support commercial sales.as necessary or directed, with installation technicians sufficiently to ensure the timely and correct installation of products and services purchased at a high standard of excellence such to promote an outstanding customer experience.a relationship with existing customers, providing an outlet for issues with billing or service and to ensure customer retention and satisfaction.Complete bi-monthly logs and reports.Plan and implement participation in corporate or community events to increase sales and brand awareness.Work with management team to identify and implement new products specific to target audience.Work with management team to identify potential areas for network expansion.Develop and maintain relationships with elected officials, community leaders, and key organizations such as chambers of commerce, school boards, and development authorities.Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending company or vendor provided workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; or participating in professional societies which may require overnight travel.
Qualifications include:school diploma or equivalent.years of successful sales experience in telecommunications or related fieldStrong written and oral communication skills.Experience in a commissioned based sales environment.Strong client prospecting and closing skills and a proven ability to work both independently and in a team environment.Must be detail oriented in completing reports, proposals, and daily schedules while setting and meeting priorities.Must have excellent organization skills to work with and coordinate installation of sales order and communicating with customer activities/schedule.Must have excellent account management skills to identify any issues and work to resolve them in meeting customer expectations and company’s commitment to excellence.Knowledge of current industry-related terminology, procedures, and equipment. Should have proficient knowledge of CRM programs.Must have a valid driver’s license.
Tri-CoGo is the broadband affiliate of Tri-County EMC. Established in 2020, Tri-CoGo is one of Georgia’s fastest growing internet service providers, serving customers in eight middle Georgia counties.
Tri-County EMC is a community-focused electric cooperative created to efficiently deliver affordable, reliable, and sustainable energy to more than 22,000 meters serving homes, businesses, farms, and schools. We are led by and belong to the communities we serve—portions of Jones, Baldwin, Putnam, Twiggs, Wilkinson, Bibb & Jasper Counties.
If you have Telecommunications Business Development/sales experience, Apply today and be sure to attach a copy of your resume.
A complete job description can be found at www.tri-cogo.com and www.tri-countyemc.com or
